gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Mark
gospel.text:
[[Mc 8,22]]When Jesus and his disciples arrived at Bethsaida, people brought to him a blind man and begged Jesus to touch him.
[[Mc 8,23]]He took the blind man by the hand and led him outside the village. Putting spittle on his eyes he laid his hands on him and asked, "Do you see anything?"
[[Mc 8,24]]Looking up he replied, "I see people looking like trees and walking."
[[Mc 8,25]]Then he laid hands on his eyes a second time and he saw clearly; his sight was restored and he could see everything distinctly.
[[Mc 8,26]]Then he sent him home and said, "Do not even go into the village."

first_reading.title: Letter of James
first_reading.text:
[[Jc 1,19]]Know this, my dear brothers: everyone should be quick to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath,
[[Jc 1,20]]for the wrath of a man does not accomplish the righteousness of God.
[[Jc 1,21]]Therefore, put away all filth and evil excess and humbly welcome the word that has been planted in you and is able to save your souls.
[[Jc 1,22]]Be doers of the word and not hearers only, deluding yourselves.
[[Jc 1,23]]For if anyone is a hearer of the word and not a doer, he is like a man who looks at his own face in a mirror.
[[Jc 1,24]]He sees himself, then goes off and promptly forgets what he looked like.
[[Jc 1,25]]But the one who peers into the perfect law of freedom and perseveres, and is not a hearer who forgets but a doer who acts, such a one shall be blessed in what he does.
[[Jc 1,26]]If anyone thinks he is religious and does not bridle his tongue but deceives his heart, his religion is vain.
[[Jc 1,27]]Religion that is pure and undefiled before God and the Father is this: to care for orphans and widows in their affliction and to keep oneself unstained by the world.

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 15,2]]He who walks blamelessly and does justice; 
who thinks the truth in his heart
[[Ps 15,3a]]and slanders not with his tongue.
[[Ps 15,3b]]Who harms not his fellow man,

[[Ps 15,3c]]nor takes up a reproach against his neighbor;
[[Ps 15,4a]]By whom the reprobate is despised,
[[Ps 15,4b]]while he honors those who fear the LORD.
[[Ps 15,5]]Who lends not his money at usury 

and accepts no bribe against the innocent. 
One who does these things 
shall never be disturbed.
